channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Chatbots Show Promise in Swaying Voters, Researchers Find
item.description: How far are we from a chatbot president?

item.title: Microsoft is quietly walking back its diversity efforts
item.description: Microsoft has been publishing data about the gender, race, and ethnic breakdown of its employees for more than a decade. Since 2019 it's been publishing a full diversity and inclusion report annually, and at the same time made reporting on diversity a requirement for employee performance reviews. Now it's scrapping its diversity report and dropping […]...

item.title: The future for women investors is in danger
item.description: Cultural and political shifts and tight markets are making it increasingly tough for women-led funds to preserve their hard-fought gains. Only about 10 percent of venture funds ever make it to a fourth vintage. Of those, just 5 to 10 percent are led by women. I’m one of them.

item.title: North Face x Skims is hitting the slopes for a second season
item.description: With North Face x Skims and Jacquemus x Nike, this winter, skiing is a state of mind. It’s a great week to have a disposable income and act like you know how to ski.

item.title: Face aux smartphones noirs et tristes, le Motorola Edge 70 Pantone Color of the Year 2026 fait un bien fou
item.description: C'est devenu un rituel. Chaque année, Motorola s'accapare la couleur Pantone pour tenter de se différencier. Cette fois, avec le Edge 70, ils vont plus loin. Finesse extrême de 5,99 mm, finition "Cloud Dancer" et cristaux incrustés.

item.title: AMD CEO Lisa Su Says Concerns About an AI Bubble Are Overblown
item.description: Lisa Su leads Nvidia’s biggest rival in the AI chip market. When asked at WIRED’s Big Interview event if AI is a bubble, company said “Emphatically, from my perspective, no.”

item.title: From the NFL to Startup Battlefield: How Alltroo built a brand that wins
item.description: On season one of Build Mode: Product, Meet Market, we explore what it really takes to get your product into the hands of customers. We’ve talked a lot about product-market fit, but this week we take a step back to something just as essential and far less discussed: founder-market fit. Investors love to ask, “What’s your competitive advantage?” Usually they’re talking about moats, […]...

item.title: Google’s AI model is getting really good at spoofing phone photos
item.description: I'm starting to understand where Google's visual AI model gets its name, because after playing around with it for a couple of days, that's how I'd sum it up: bananas. The images it generates are so realistic it's bananas. I feel like I'm going bananas after staring at them for too long. And if I […]

item.title: Russia blocks FaceTime and Snapchat, tightening its control online
item.description: The announcement comes after the Kremlin blocked Roblox, Signal, Twitter, and many other online platforms. Russian authorities said Thursday they have imposed restrictions on Apple’s video calling service FaceTime, the latest step in an effort to tighten control over the internet and communications online.

item.title: La crise est telle que Samsung refuse de se vendre de la RAM à lui-même
item.description: Si vous avez observé le secteur des composants PC ces derniers temps, il est impossible que vous soyez passé à côté de la crise qui touche le marché de la RAM dont tous les composants sont siphonnés par l’industrie de l’IA. Samsung le sait mieux que personne.

item.title: Legal AI startup Harvey confirms $8B valuation
item.description: Harvey confirms a third enormous round of funding in 2025 that has skyrocketed its valuation. Again.

item.title: Nic Cage Is Playing Ben Reilly in ‘Spider-Noir’
item.description: Spider-Man Noir is swinging to Prime Video next year... but not with the name you're expecting.

item.title: Ray-Ban’s Meta smart glasses are even cheaper than they were on Black Friday
item.description: It sounds weird to say it’s a good thing if you missed the Ray-Ban Meta deal on Black Friday, but… it’s kind of true. The original Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses just fell to an even better all-time low of $224.25 ($75) at Amazon and Best Buy, which beats the Black Friday price by $15. That’s a great deal because, even […]

item.title: Trump to roll back Biden-era fuel economy standards that limit air pollution
item.description: Automakers applauded the planned changes, which came amid industry complaints that the current rules were difficult to meet. President Donald Trump on Wednesday announced a proposal to weaken vehicle mileage rules for the auto industry, loosening regulatory pressure on automakers to control pollution from gasoline-powered cars and trucks.

item.title: Sanctioned spyware maker Intellexa had direct access to government espionage victims, researchers say
item.description: Based on a leaked video, security researchers alleged that Intellexa staffers have remote live access to their customers' surveillance systems, allowing them to see hacking targets’ personal data.

item.title: Hyundai’s charming autonomous robot can be everything from a golf trolley to an e-scooter – and it's going on sale soon
item.description: Hyundai announces its first production-ready autonomous robot that wants be your friend and your co-worker.

item.title: Post Cyber Monday deal: The Ray-Ban Meta Wayfarer sunglasses are at a record-low price
item.description: The Ray-Ban Meta Wayfarer smart AI sunglasses are on sale at Amazon for $246.75, down from the normal price of $329. That's a 25% discount.

item.title: Hemp-THC drinks were the hottest thing in zero-proof culture. Congress just put them on notice
item.description: The new rule slashes allowable THC levels to a fraction of what’s in popular hemp spritzes, putting a fast-growing alcohol alternative at risk. The bill that brought the government back online last month ended the shutdown with an unexpected catch that could crush an entire industry.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang lobbies Trump and Republicans over AI chip restrictions
item.description: Huang is among the Silicon Valley executives who warn that any restrictions on AI will halt its advancement despite mounting concerns. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang met separately with President Donald Trump and Republican senators Wednesday as tech executives work to secure favorable federal policies for the artificial intelligence industry, including the limited sale of Nvidia’s highly valued computer chips to U.S. rivals like China....

item.title: Rare disease: Our $1 trillion healthcare reform opportunity
item.description: Expanded newborn genetic screening can diagnose hundreds of actionable conditions, allowing for earlier treatment. Every year in the United States, thousands of families face a devastating reality: Their child has a rare disease, but they won’t know it until it’s too late for effective intervention. Thirty percent of children with rare diseases don’t live to see their fifth birthday....

item.title: The pros and cons of being un-self-aware
item.description: Is it really always best to know thyself? The world of popular psychological ideas, which is largely the self-help industry, is not short of contradictions. For instance, it simultaneously promotes the benefits of emotional intelligence (the ability to empathize with others and engage in strategic impression management) and authenticity (the tendency to express what you really feel and think without much consideration for others’ opinions). It also frequently celebrates self-acceptance and constant self-improvement (“love yourself as you are”… but also “become the best version of yourself”), m...

item.title: La Russie bloque les appels FaceTime
item.description: Il n'est plus possible de passer des appels FaceTime en Russie. Les autorités reprochent au service d'Apple de faciliter des opérations terroristes. Le pays mène une véritable guérilla contre les plateformes étrangères.

item.title: It sure looks like Samsungs new OLED TVs just leaked before CES
item.description: Samsung's new OLED TV models appear to have leaked online as the company prepares for next year's CES.

item.title: Amazon’s new Kindle Scribe and Kindle Scribe Colorsoft launch on December 10
item.description: The new Kindle Scribe has a larger 11-inch glare-free display, is just 5.4 mm thick, and weighs only 400 g. It’s also 40% faster when writing or turning pages.

item.title: New Baldness Drug Boosted Hair Growth by 539% in Trials
item.description: The topical medication, called Clascoterone, could represent the first truly novel drug for male pattern baldness seen in about 30 years.

item.title: Roblox, FaceTime become the last targets of Russia's censorship
item.description: Russia has blocked FaceTime and Roblox, tightening its censorship push as users lose access to most major Western platforms.

item.title: Arm64 dominates AWS Lambda in 2025: Rust 4-5x faster than x86, costs 30% less across all workloads
item.description: AWS Lambda benchmarks in 2025 show arm64 consistently outperforms x86 across Rust, Python, and Node.js, and significantly reduces costs.

item.title: Hulu renews Chad Powers for season 2, and Glen Powell says it actually has a satisfying arc planned
item.description: Chad Powers will return back to the playing field and star Glenn Powell teased they've had big plans for its future.

item.title: Forget Spotify Wrapped, get back into CDs with FiiO’s gorgeous new portable player
item.description: CDs are so back, baby! FiiO’s new portable player is also a hi-res DAC, Bluetooth transmitter and wireless bridge for your music

item.title: How an unemployed teacher is changing public education
item.description: Kids and communities are responding to seeds of hope planted in the concrete jungle. The Bronx stands apart from New York City’s four other boroughs in stark ways. Home to 1.4 million residents and the nation’s poorest congressional district, it once flourished as fertile farmland. Today, we’re restoring this land—not to its agricultural roots, but as fertile ground for raising healthy, happy, and prosperous children....

item.title: AI’s future runs on water
item.description: The tech sector must lead now. The rise of artificial intelligence is transforming every industry, but it also creates enormous demand for digital infrastructure and natural resources. Data centers, the engines of this transformation, consume vast amounts of water and energy.

item.title: Customer data stolen in Freedom Mobile account management platform hack
item.description: A third-party attack hits the Canadian telco, users lose names, phone numbers, and user accounts.

item.title: Marvel Rivals now has a gacha mini-game featuring a limited-time Psylocke bundle – here's how it works
item.description: The first anniversary of Marvel Rivals is right around the corner, and to continue the celebrations, a new gacha system has been added to the game that will reward players with a limited-time hero bundle.

item.title: Black Friday may be over but our exclusive Norton VPN deal is still going strong
item.description: This great price on a new VPN courtesy of cybersecurity giant Norton will help lift your post-Black Friday blues.

item.title: Quels sont les meilleurs écrans PC Ultrawide 21/9 et 32/9 en 2025 ? Le comparatif
item.description: Si vous êtes à la recherche d’un écran gaming très large ou d'une vaste interface pour le travail, vous êtes au bon endroit. Découvrez notre sélection des meilleurs écrans ultrawide.

item.title: À peine 20 € pour cette batterie externe MagSafe certifiée Qi2 10 000 mAh, c’est le super deal du jour
item.description: Cette batterie externe Baseus AirPow II est conçue pour une charge rapide filaire ou sans-fil que vous retrouvez pour 22,39 euros sur Amazon au lieu de 31,99 euros.
